correct_order: The colors of the sunset result from a phenomenon called scattering, says Steven Ackerman, professor of meteorology at UW_Madison.
Molecules and small particles in the atmosphere change the direction of light rays, causing them to scatter.
Scattering affects the color of light coming from the sky
But the details are determined by the wavelength of the light and the size of the particle.
